messageBody:
Hi Johannes,
Thanks very much for your input. Currently the TreeNode classes do
not expose their internals and if I have to navigate the tree from
the TestCase and validate values, I'll need to add these to the
interface.

But, doesn't this break encapsulation in a way? In this application,
I do not think any other client classes will be interested in picking
and choosing nodes and checking its contents. They would only send
messages to the TreeHolder and let the TreeHolder delegate it on.

Another option is of course to make these additional methods package
accessible ...

Thanks very much for your help.
--Das

--- In junit@y..., Johannes Link <john.link@g...> wrote:

> If the forwarding is anything but very very simple, I prefer to
test it.
> You can test (a) if the correct set of nodes has been chosen for
> forwarding (b) if the correct method in the nodes is called. IMO
this
> holds enough potential for (future) failure.
> To be frank, I personally test even the most trivial delegation
method.
> With those tests in my back I haven't got to add many tests during
> refactoring. Adding lots of tests when refactoring breaks my flow.
>
> Johannes
